rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.STUDYID

classVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used by the sponsor to uniquely identify the study.
classVariables.label: Study Identifier
classVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.DOMAIN

classVariables.definition: An abbreviation for a collection of observations, with a topic-specific commonality.
classVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
classVariables.name: DOMAIN
classVariables.notes: 2-character abbreviation. The domain abbreviation is also used as a prefix for variables to ensure uniqueness when datasets are merged.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.USUBJID

classVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
classVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
classVariables.name: USUBJID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.POOLID

classVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify a group of subjects that have been pooled together.
classVariables.label: Pool Identifier
classVariables.name: POOLID
classVariables.notes: Used for results that are not assignable to a specific subject.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.SPDEVID

classVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used by the sponsor to uniquely identify a specific device.
classVariables.label: Sponsor Device Identifier
classVariables.name: SPDEVID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.NHOID

classVariables.label: Non-Host Organism Identifier
classVariables.name: NHOID
classVariables.notes: Sponsor-defined identifier for a non-host organism. This variable should be populated with an intuitive name based on the identity of the non-host organism as reported by the lab.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.FETUSID

classVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify a fetus associated with a maternal subject, for a particular prenatal evaluation.
classVariables.label: Fetus Identifier
classVariables.name: FETUSID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.FOCID

classVariables.examples: A drug application site (e.g., "Injection site 1", "Biopsy site 1", "Treated site 1"), or a more specific focus (e.g., "OD" (right eye), "Upper left quadrant of the back")
classVariables.label: Focus of Study-Specific Interest
classVariables.name: FOCID
classVariables.notes: Identification of a focus of study-specific interest on or within a subject or specimen as called out in the protocol for which a measurement, test, or examination was performed. The value in this variable should have inherent semantic meaning.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--SEQ

classVariables.definition: A number used in combination with the identifier of the subject of the observation to uniquely identify a record within a domain.
classVariables.label: Sequence Number
classVariables.name: --SEQ
classVariables.notes: May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1. Datasets that do not contain subject data, such as the Trial Summary (TS) domain and the Device Tracking (DT) domains, use --SEQ as a sequence number to ensure uniqueness within the dataset.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--GRPID

classVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify related records for a subject within a domain, or related parameters in the Trial Summary (TS) dataset.
classVariables.label: Group ID
classVariables.name: --GRPID
classVariables.notes: See also Section 5.1.6, Trial Summary Information and Section 5.1.7, Challenge Agent Characterization.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--REFID

classVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify a source of information.
classVariables.examples: A lab specimen ID, the UUID for an ECG waveform or a medical image.
classVariables.label: Reference ID
classVariables.name: --REFID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--RECID

classVariables.label: Invariant Record Identifier
classVariables.name: --RECID
classVariables.notes: Identifier for a record that is unique within a domain for a study and that remains invariant through subsequent versions of the dataset, even if the content of the record is modified. When a record is deleted, this value must not be reused to identify another record in either the current or future versions of the domain.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--SPID

classVariables.definition: A sponsor-defined sequence of characters used to identify an instance of an observation.
classVariables.examples: A preprinted line identifier on a Concomitant Medications form.
classVariables.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
classVariables.name: --SPID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--LNKID

classVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify a record, for a subject, in one domain and link it to 1 or more records for that subject in another domain.
classVariables.examples: A value that links a single tumor to multiple measurements/assessments performed at different times.
classVariables.label: Link ID
classVariables.name: --LNKID
classVariables.notes: This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--LNKGRP

classVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify a group of records, for a subject, in one domain and link it to 1 or more records for that subject in another domain.
classVariables.examples: A value that links multiple tumor measurement/assessments to a single response to therapy.
classVariables.label: Link Group ID
classVariables.name: --LNKGRP
classVariables.notes: This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--BEATNO

classVariables.label: ECG Beat Number
classVariables.name: --BEATNO
classVariables.notes: A sequence number that identifies the beat within an ECG.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.VISITNUM

classVariables.definition: An assigned numeric identifier that aligns to the chronological order of a clinical encounter.
classVariables.label: Visit Number
classVariables.name: VISITNUM
classVariables.notes: Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. VISITNUM does not have to be an integer value.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.VISIT

classVariables.definition: The label for a protocol-defined clinical encounter.
classVariables.label: Visit Name
classVariables.name: VISIT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.VISITDY

classVariables.definition: The planned study day of a clinical encounter relative to the sponsor-defined reference start date.
classVariables.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
classVariables.name: VISITDY
classVariables.notes: Should be an integer.

priorVersion.title: Planned Order of Element Within Arm

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.TAETORD

self.title: Planned Order of Element Within Arm

classVariables.definition: An assigned numeric identifier that gives the planned order of the element within the trial arm of the study.
classVariables.label: Planned Order of Element Within Arm
classVariables.name: TAETORD
classVariables.notes: See Section 5.1.1.2, Trial Arms.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.EPOCH

classVariables.definition: A time period defined in the protocol with a study-specific purpose.
classVariables.label: Epoch
classVariables.name: EPOCH
classVariables.notes: The epoch associated with an observation is determined by the start date or start date and time of the observation, or the date/time of collection if start date/time is not collected (see Section 5.1.1.2, Trial Arms).

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.RPHASE

classVariables.label: Repro Phase
classVariables.name: RPHASE
classVariables.notes: Reproductive phase with which the reproductive stage of the reproductive path is associated. Defined in Trial Paths domain. The RPHASE variable is Required when any Reproductive Phase Day variable is used.

priorVersion.title: Planned Repro Phase Day of Observation

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.RPPLDY

self.title: Planned Repro Phase Day of Observation

classVariables.definition: The day within the reproductive phase on which the test or observation was scheduled to occur.
classVariables.label: Planned Repro Phase Day of Observation
classVariables.name: RPPLDY
classVariables.notes: Expressed as an integer.

priorVersion.title: Planned Repro Phase Day of Obs Start

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.RPPLSTDY

self.title: Planned Repro Phase Day of Obs Start

classVariables.definition: The day within the reproductive phase on which the test or observation was scheduled to begin.
classVariables.label: Planned Repro Phase Day of Obs Start
classVariables.name: RPPLSTDY
classVariables.notes: Expressed as an integer.

priorVersion.title: Planned Repro Phase Day of Obs End

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.RPPLENDY

self.title: Planned Repro Phase Day of Obs End

classVariables.definition: The day within the reproductive phase on which the test or observation was scheduled to end.
classVariables.label: Planned Repro Phase Day of Obs End
classVariables.name: RPPLENDY
classVariables.notes: Expressed as an integer.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--DTC

classVariables.definition: The date or date and time of the assessment or the specimen or data collection from the subject, represented in a standardized character format.
classVariables.label: Date/Time of Collection
classVariables.name: --DTC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--STDTC

classVariables.definition: The start date or date and time of an intervention or event, represented in a standardized character format.
classVariables.label: Start Date/Time of Observation
classVariables.name: --STDTC
classVariables.notes: The start date of a Findings class record is stored in the --DTC variable.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ENDTC

classVariables.definition: The end date or date and time of an intervention, event, or finding, represented in a standardized character format.
classVariables.label: End Date/Time of Observation
classVariables.name: --ENDTC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--DY

classVariables.definition: The number of days from the sponsor-defined reference start date to the date of collection (--DTC), used in study data tabulation.
classVariables.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
classVariables.name: --DY
classVariables.notes: The sponsor-defined reference start date is RFSTDTC in Demographics.

priorVersion.title: Study Day of Start of Observation

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--STDY

self.title: Study Day of Start of Observation

classVariables.definition: The number of days from the sponsor-defined reference start date to the start of an intervention or event (--STDTC), used for study data tabulation.
classVariables.label: Study Day of Start of Observation
classVariables.name: --STDY
classVariables.notes: The sponsor-defined reference start date is RFSTDTC in Demographics.

priorVersion.title: Study Day of End of Observation

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ENDY

self.title: Study Day of End of Observation

classVariables.definition: The number of days from the sponsor-defined reference start date to the end of an intervention, event, or finding (--ENDTC), used for study data tabulation.
classVariables.label: Study Day of End of Observation
classVariables.name: --ENDY
classVariables.notes: The sponsor-defined reference start date is RFSTDTC in Demographics.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--NOMDY

classVariables.definition: The nominal study day, relative to the sponsor-defined reference start date, used by data collection and reporting systems for grouping records for observations that may be scheduled to occur on different days into a single study day (e.g., for output on a tabulation report).
classVariables.label: Nominal Study Day for Tabulations
classVariables.name: --NOMDY

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--NOMLBL

classVariables.definition: The name for a protocol-defined nominal study day.
classVariables.label: Label for Nominal Study Day
classVariables.name: --NOMLBL
classVariables.notes: As presented in the study report.

priorVersion.title: Actual Repro Phase Day of Observation

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--RPDY

self.title: Actual Repro Phase Day of Observation

classVariables.definition: The day within the reproductive phase on which the test or observation occurred.
classVariables.label: Actual Repro Phase Day of Observation
classVariables.name: --RPDY
classVariables.notes: Expressed as an integer.

priorVersion.title: Actual Repro Phase Day of Obs Start

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--RPSTDY

self.title: Actual Repro Phase Day of Obs Start

classVariables.definition: The day within the reproductive phase on which the test or observation began.
classVariables.label: Actual Repro Phase Day of Obs Start
classVariables.name: --RPSTDY
classVariables.notes: Expressed as an integer.

priorVersion.title: Actual Repro Phase Day of Obs End

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--RPENDY

self.title: Actual Repro Phase Day of Obs End

classVariables.definition: The day within the reproductive phase on which the test or observation ended.
classVariables.label: Actual Repro Phase Day of Obs End
classVariables.name: --RPENDY
classVariables.notes: Expressed as an integer.

priorVersion.title: Day of Obs Relative to Exposure

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--XDY

self.title: Day of Obs Relative to Exposure

classVariables.label: Day of Obs Relative to Exposure
classVariables.name: --XDY
classVariables.notes: The actual study day of an intervention, event, or finding, derived relative to the first exposure to any protocol-specified treatment. Expressed in integer days relative to RFXSTDTC in Demographics.

priorVersion.title: Start Day of Obs Relative to Exposure

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--XSTDY

self.title: Start Day of Obs Relative to Exposure

classVariables.label: Start Day of Obs Relative to Exposure
classVariables.name: --XSTDY
classVariables.notes: The actual study day of the start of an intervention or event, derived relative to the first exposure to any protocol-specified treatment. Expressed in integer days relative to RFXSTDTC in Demographics.

priorVersion.title: End Day of Obs Relative to Exposure

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--XENDY

self.title: End Day of Obs Relative to Exposure

classVariables.label: End Day of Obs Relative to Exposure
classVariables.name: --XENDY
classVariables.notes: The actual study day of the end of an intervention, event, or finding, derived relative to the first exposure to any protocol-specified treatment. Expressed in integer days relative to RFXSTDTC in Demographics.

priorVersion.title: Day of Obs Rel to Challenge Agent

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--CHDY

self.title: Day of Obs Rel to Challenge Agent

classVariables.label: Day of Obs Rel to Challenge Agent
classVariables.name: --CHDY
classVariables.notes: The actual study day of an intervention, event, or finding, derived relative to the first exposure to the challenge agent that induces the disease or condition that the investigational treatment is intended to cure, mitigate, treat, or prevent. Expressed in integer days relative to RFCSTDTC in Demographics.

priorVersion.title: Start Day of Obs Rel to Challenge Agent

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--CHSTDY

self.title: Start Day of Obs Rel to Challenge Agent

classVariables.label: Start Day of Obs Rel to Challenge Agent
classVariables.name: --CHSTDY
classVariables.notes: The actual study day of the start of an intervention or event derived relative to the first exposure to the challenge agent that induces the disease or condition that the investigational treatment is intended to c ure, mitigate, treat, or prevent. Expressed in integer days relative to RFCSTDTC in Demographics.

priorVersion.title: End Day of Obs Rel to Challenge Agent

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--CHENDY

self.title: End Day of Obs Rel to Challenge Agent

classVariables.label: End Day of Obs Rel to Challenge Agent
classVariables.name: --CHENDY
classVariables.notes: The actual study day of the end of an intervention, event, or finding derived relative to the first exposure to the challenge agent that induces the disease or condition that the investigational treatment is intended to cure, mitigate, treat, or prevent. Expressed in integer days relative to RFCSTDTC in Demographics.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--DUR

classVariables.definition: The collected length of time during which an observation continues, represented in a standardized character format.
classVariables.label: Collected Duration
classVariables.name: --DUR
classVariables.notes: Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--TPT

classVariables.definition: The description of the time when a protocol-defined activity is planned to occur, used for study data tabulation.
classVariables.label: Planned Time Point Name
classVariables.name: --TPT
classVariables.notes: This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (e.g., time since last dose). See --TPTNUM and --TPTREF.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--TPTNUM

classVariables.definition: The numeric identifier of when an observation is planned to occur.
classVariables.label: Planned Time Point Number
classVariables.name: --TPTNUM
classVariables.notes: Used in sorting.

priorVersion.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ELTM

self.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

classVariables.definition: The interval of time between a planned time point and a fixed reference point, represented in a standardized character format.
classVariables.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
classVariables.name: --ELTM
classVariables.notes: The fixed reference point is in --TPTREF. This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--TPTREF

classVariables.definition: The description of a time point that acts as a fixed reference for a series of planned time points, used for study data tabulation.
classVariables.label: Time Point Reference
classVariables.name: --TPTREF
classVariables.notes: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by --ELTM, --TPTNUM, --TPT, --STINT, and --ENINT.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--RFTDTC

classVariables.definition: The actual date or date and time of a time point that acts as a fixed reference for a series of planned time points, represented in a standardized character format.
classVariables.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
classVariables.name: --RFTDTC
classVariables.notes: The fixed reference point is in --TPTREF.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--STRF

classVariables.definition: The characterization of the start of an observation relative to the study reference period.
classVariables.label: Start Relative to Reference Period
classVariables.name: --STRF
classVariables.notes: The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ENRF

classVariables.definition: The characterization of the end of an observation relative to the study reference period.
classVariables.label: End Relative to Reference Period
classVariables.name: --ENRF
classVariables.notes: The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--EVLINT

classVariables.definition: The planned time interval for which an observation is assessed, represented in a standardized character format.
classVariables.examples: -P2M to represent a period of the past 2 months as the evaluation interval for a question from a questionnaire.
classVariables.label: Evaluation Interval
classVariables.name: --EVLINT
classVariables.notes: Usually used with --DTC to describe an interval of this duration that ended at the time represented in --DTC.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--EVINTX

classVariables.definition: A textual description of the planned time interval for which an observation is assessed, where the interval is not able to be represented in a standardized character format.
classVariables.label: Evaluation Interval Text
classVariables.name: --EVINTX
classVariables.notes: A value that cannot be represented in ISO 8601 format.

priorVersion.title: Start Relative to Reference Time Point

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--STRTPT

self.title: Start Relative to Reference Time Point

classVariables.definition: The characterization of the start of an observation relative to a reference time point.
classVariables.label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point
classVariables.name: --STRTPT
classVariables.notes: The sponsor-defined reference time point is in --STTPT.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--STTPT

classVariables.definition: The description or date and/or time of a time point that acts as a fixed reference for characterizing the start of an observation.
classVariables.label: Start Reference Time Point
classVariables.name: --STTPT
classVariables.notes: This is the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by --STRTPT.

priorVersion.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ENRTPT

self.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

classVariables.definition: The characterization of the end of an observation relative to a reference time point.
classVariables.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
classVariables.name: --ENRTPT
classVariables.notes: The sponsor-defined reference time point is in --ENTPT.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ENTPT

classVariables.definition: The description or date and/or time of a time point that acts as a fixed reference for characterizing the end of an observation.
classVariables.label: End Reference Time Point
classVariables.name: --ENTPT
classVariables.notes: This is the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by --ENRTPT.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.MIDS

classVariables.label: Disease Milestone Instance Name
classVariables.name: MIDS
classVariables.notes: The name of a specific instance of a Disease Milestone Type (MIDSTYPE) described in the Trial Disease Milestones dataset (see Section 5.1.4.3, Trial Disease Milestones). This should be unique within a subject. Used only in conjunction with RELMIDS and MIDSDTC.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.RELMIDS

classVariables.label: Temporal Relation to Milestone Instance
classVariables.name: RELMIDS
classVariables.notes: The temporal relationship of the observation to the Disease Milestone Instance Name in MIDS.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.MIDSDTC

classVariables.label: Disease Milestone Instance Date/Time
classVariables.name: MIDSDTC
classVariables.notes: The start date/time of the Disease Milestone Instance Name in MIDS.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--STINT

classVariables.definition: The start of a planned assessment interval relative to a reference time point, represented in a standardized character format.
classVariables.label: Planned Start of Assessment Interval
classVariables.name: --STINT
classVariables.notes: The reference time point is in --TPTREF. As this variable describes planned timing of an assessment, caution should be exercised when using outside of the Findings class of domains. In an Events or Interventions domain, it may refer to the interval over which --OCCUR is assessed.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--ENINT

classVariables.definition: The end of a planned assessment interval relative to a reference time point, represented in a standardized character format.
classVariables.label: Planned End of Assessment Interval
classVariables.name: --ENINT
classVariables.notes: The reference time point is in --TPTREF. As this variable describes planned timing of an assessment, caution should be exercised when using outside of the Findings class of domains. In an Events or Interventions domain, it may refer to the interval over which --OCCUR is assessed.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--DETECT

classVariables.definition: The number of days from the start of dosing to the earliest detection of a condition or pathogen.
classVariables.label: Time in Days to Detection
classVariables.name: --DETECT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--PTFL

classVariables.label: Point in Time Flag
classVariables.name: --PTFL
classVariables.notes: An indication that the specimen was collected at a single point in time. The value is "Y" or null.
classVariables.usageRestrictions: Only in Findings class specimen-based domains: BS, CP, GF, IS, LB, MB, MS, MI, PC, PP

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable GeneralObservations.--PDUR

classVariables.label: Planned Duration
classVariables.name: --PDUR
classVariables.notes: Planned duration of a finding. For a sample-based finding, this could apply to the planned duration of specimen collection.
classVariables.usageRestrictions: Only in Findings class specimen-based domains: BS, CP, GF, IS, LB, MB, MS, MI, PC, PP

description: The majority of observations collected during a study can be divided among three general classes: Interventions, Events, or Findings. Datasets based on any of the general observation classes share a set of common Identifier and Timing variables. As a general rule, any valid Identifier or Timing variable is permissible for use in any submission dataset based on a general observation class. (Source: SDTM v2.0, Section 3.1)
label: General Observations
name: General Observations
